Class MovieService

java.lang.Object
dms.service.MovieService
public class MovieService extends Object
Service layer that coordinates validation and orchestration between the GUI and the DAO layer.

Responsibilities:

  • Keep business rules and input validation outside the GUI.
  • Delegate persistence to a MovieDao implementation (MySQL in this project).
  • Provide convenience methods used by controllers and dialogs.

Author: Luis Augusto Monserratt Alvarado

Version: 1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • MovieService

      public MovieService(MovieDao dao)
      Constructs the service with a specific DAO implementation.
      Parameters:
      dao - non-null DAO implementation (e.g., MysqlMovieDao)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if dao is null

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect(String jdbcUrl, String user, String pass) throws SQLException
      Opens a database connection when the underlying DAO supports it (i.e., MysqlMovieDao).
      Parameters:
      jdbcUrl - JDBC URL (e.g., jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/dms_movies?serverTimezone=UTC)
      user - database username
      pass - database password
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the connection attempt fails
      IllegalStateException - if the configured DAO does not support connections

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Indicates whether the underlying DAO is currently connected (for MysqlMovieDao only).
      Returns:
      true if connected; false otherwise

    • close

      public void close() throws SQLException
      Closes the database connection if supported by the underlying DAO.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if closing the connection fails

    • create

      public void create(Movie movie) throws SQLException
      Creates a new movie after validating its fields.
      Parameters:
      movie - movie to create (must be non-null and valid)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the insert fails at the DAO layer
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails

    • readAll

      public List<Movie> readAll() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all movies from the database.
      Returns:
      a non-null list of movies (possibly empty)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • readById

      public Optional<Movie> readById(String id) throws SQLException
      Retrieves a movie by its string ID (e.g., "INT2010").
      Parameters:
      id - movie primary key (VARCHAR(10)); cannot be null/blank
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the movie if found, otherwise empty
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if id is null or blank

    • update

      public void update(Movie movie) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing movie (matched by the entity's primary key).
      Parameters:
      movie - updated movie data (must be valid and contain a primary key)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the update fails or no row is affected
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails

    • deleteById

      public boolean deleteById(String id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a movie by its string ID (matches VARCHAR(10) PK).
      Parameters:
      id - movie ID to delete (cannot be null/blank)
      Returns:
      true if a row was deleted; false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if id is null or blank

    • searchByTitle

      public List<Movie> searchByTitle(String titleFragment) throws SQLException
      Performs a case-insensitive title search via a custom DAO method.
      Parameters:
      titleFragment - partial title text to search
      Returns:
      a non-null list of matches (possibly empty)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IllegalStateException - if the configured DAO does not support this operation

    • averageDuration

      public double averageDuration() throws SQLException
      Computes the average duration (in minutes) of all movies.
      Returns:
      average duration as a double; returns 0.0 if there are no movies
      Throws:
      SQLException - if retrieving movies fails
